result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Attorney McClain
body only
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Attorney Mcclain appeared in court.  Attorney Mcclain does not know where the defendant is.  Warrant authorized.
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
STC rescheduled as Atty Mcclain hasn't received Discovery info yet; DA to mail out today.
Defendant's
from Attorney McClain

Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to attorney.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Defendant wants to represent himself.  Court explained attorney options.  He doesn't trust them.  He will represent himself.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Defendant entered NGP.  Court entered the same.  PTC set for 8/10 and STC set for 8/29 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: K. Y.  Other than for official court business at the Ho-Chunk Nation.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Defendant requesting no contact be lifted.  State objects.
